alert.note: Alert for Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 2:13AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel and south central Jackson Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 213 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Bernstadt, or near London, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... London, Victory and Eberle around 220 AM EDT. Atlanta and Peoples around 230 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Greenmount, Maplesville, Mcwhorter, Crawford, Royrader, Moores Creek and Green Hill. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 46. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 7 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
